questions.question: Neither James nor his children ………………………. English.
questions.description: When we connect a singular noun and a plural noun with neither/nor, the verb agrees in number and person with the noun following nor.

questions.question: Neither Sam nor his brother ………………………
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: The farmer along with his children ……………………. hard day and night.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: Neither you nor he ……………………….. capable of doing this.
questions.description: When we connect two pronouns with neither/nor, the verb agrees in number and person with the pronoun following nor.

questions.question: The writer and orator ……………………. no more.
questions.description: Here both nouns refer to the same person and hence we use a singular verb. If they referred to different persons, we would use the article before each noun.

questions.question: The man as well as his wife …………………….. guilty.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former in number and person.

questions.question: Being bilingual ……………………….. an advantage in the modern world.
questions.description: Here the subject is the gerund phrase being bilingual. It is considered singular.

questions.question: Trespassing ……………………… prohibited.
When we were children, we ……………………… long hours playing.
How they escaped ……………………. a mystery.
questions.description: When the subject is a noun clause, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Despite ………………………. rich, he is not happy.
Neither you nor I ………………………….. right.
questions.description: When we connect two pronouns with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the pronoun following nor.

questions.question: Neither pleasure nor pain ……………………… to move him.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Neither the master nor his servants …………………………… present in the barn.
questions.description: When we connect a singular noun and a plural noun with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the number and person of the noun closest to it.

questions.question: No nook or corner ……………………………. left unsearched.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either you or I ……………………………… mistaken.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either/or, the verb agrees in number and person with the noun closest to it.

questions.question: Neither you nor he ……………………………… right.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with neither/nor, the verb agrees in number and person with the noun closest to it.

questions.question: None of them …………………………. arrived.
questions.description: A singular verb is used after none.

questions.question: All of his books …………………………. worth reading.
questions.description: Use a plural verb after all.

questions.question: She is getting married to Sam, who ………………………… her college mate.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause agrees with its antecedent in number and person.

questions.question: I who …………………………….. your patron will never desert you.
A lot of work ………………………………. to be done.
questions.description: When a lot of is followed by an uncountable noun, the verb is singular in number.

questions.question: A lot of people ……………………………….. in ghosts.
questions.description: When a lot of followed by a plural noun, the verb is plural in number.

questions.question: There ……………………….. been many studies on this subject.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: Neither the Principal nor the Lecturers ……………… present at the meeting.
Either Mehta or his parents ………………. responsible for this.
Neither Mehta nor his parents ………………… responsible for this.
Neither the Chief Minister nor his colleagues ……………….. given any explanation for this.
Neither he nor I …………………. money to spare for this.
Neither you nor Ram ………………… to be capable of doing this.
Either you or Gopal ……………….. to take the lead in this matter.
